intro: Chirita sinensis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Chinese violet, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 cm. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds and container gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and long-lasting blooms.
